reviews.review_msg:
He is very disorganized.

If I were you, I would stay away from his courses and wait for another lecturer/prof to take this course instead.

Really nice prof when you get in contact with him, but you will have to either email/meet after class since he is basically absent from the discussion forums. Grading was very chill, you really only have to worry about the weekly exercises since those are the bulk of where the learning comes from, then a group project in the last week or two.

Him and his TAs almost never respond to emails. It's almost impossible to reach out to them on any issues, either grading, project proposal, or questions. Assignment and quiz grades are not released until weeks after the course ends. Seem to scale the class down for the final grade. Highly disappointed
THE WORST Prof EVER! Never notify schedule in advance with all the old information and the info is HARD to find on the webpage. Basically you will never know what to do till the last moment.

He's knowledgeable and kind but wow. He is so disorganized. 2/4 assignments were released two weeks late, but don't worry, we got a 2 day extension. The last assignment was released incomplete with errors, and he was MIA on the discussion board so we were screwed if we had questions. The assignments weren't graded until after the final passed. Bad

Never responds to questions from students and explains concepts very poorly during lecture. He uses all of Greg Bakers materials to teach the course so just take the course with him or watch Greg's videos instead. He's a nice guy but he did the bare minimum.

Don't listen to all these haters, this guy just may be the GOAT. Explains the slides very well and is always open to questions. While slightly disorganized, he never made me feel cheated or treated unfairly. Steven is clearly very intelligent and knowledgeable and it shows. Great guy. 10/10

Has conflicting information within the lecture notes and discussion areas, both for the content and administrative details. Assignments were released weeks late while deadlines were extended by a few days at best. Only grades released before final were the automatically graded quizzes and first assignment which was due in the third week of class.

This course has been the most disorganized course I have ever taken. Assignments and quizzes were never released on time, and throughout the entire semester, there was no grading or feedback provided for any assignments. The final assignment was even updated three times before the final version was confirmed.

1. Irresponsible.
2. Highly protracted. (late in posting Assignments, releasing final info, grades, practice materials, etc).
3. Hard to comment on the Quality of Assignments...
Regardless of personal knowledges, not a helpful prof at all.

Professor reads off of slides written by Mo Chen 
No assignment mark came out before the 40% final exam! That means from the very first assignment to the very last one, no grades or solutions or feedbacks were released to the students
This is a good course someone should take if they want to kill their interest in machine learning.
First time seeing prof releasing homework super late with live patches because not all questions were ready. Read off the slides in lectures. Overall, it is just super disorganized.
I can read slides as well.
He is such a brilliant professor who encouraged everyone to build up strong self-study abilities. I think he should receive an early retirement as a reward

There are some lecturers who are incompetent. 

There are some lecturers who are unprofessional. 

Mr. Bergner somehow has combined to be both.

The quality at the university has gone down drastically. 

There is no better evidence for this fact then this lecturer. 

You would be better off spending your time and money on the internet than his courses.

This is my only positive rating on this site. I personally view how this guy runs CMPT353 as the way every course in this school should be run. No forced attendance except quiz, material is applicable to the real world, grading is fair. Only issue was lack of communication online, but, it was not usually needed. You could always go to office hours.
Just reads from his slides. The class was rushed by the end of the term. Does not communicate well. No response to emails or discussion posts.
He is not audible in the class. The slides are plagiarized.
Youtube will do a better job than this.
He is a very nice person. Could improve his style a bit because I felt he is just reading from the slides and makes less eye contact. But graded very generously.

The class was a bit rushed by the end of the term. But he graded leniently for both midterm and finals. 
Nice guy and grading team was very generous as well.
Although the exam is difficult and contains a lot of content, the professors are kind and the grading team is generous!!!, I love him!!!
There was not enough homework to prepare for the exams, however the instructional team graded very leniently.

Crammed a lot of contents in last weeks of semester, barely responded to discussion posts or emails in a timely manner, copied all of the materials from other universities. Overall just avoid this class with this professor...

The course is copied from another university. But in that university they have a total of 135 hours of lecture, while we only had about 50. With less than half of the lecture time, we are expected to learn the same material. Steven also gave many false promises during the final week. He also accused students using bots to generate bad reviews here.

Avoid this class at all cost. the instructor instead of communicating with students and teaching better, he was mad over the comments posted here. well the comments here reflects how poorly this class was. Instead of flagging reviews, think about how you controlled this class

The whole material in the class was copied from other university. He didn't both to respond to emails and discussion posts until the end of semester. I feel like I haven't learned anything at all while paying 3.3k for a course....

It's alarming how bad this experience has been. He doesn't reply on piazza/email, he's the first professor I've seen to not hold office hours, he's unclear about the topics on his exams, he gives us Berkley's exams with no preparation for how to solve those styles of questions, and he's withholding vital information we need to study for the final.

Waste of time and money. You just watch some Youtube videos and read slides from UC Berkeley and you will be able to teach this course much better than he does. Due date changes recklessly with no announcement. Not accessible outside of class. No response to discussion forum and important questions. Not keeping promises of posting materials timely.
Hands down, it was the worst class I took...

Complete waste of time and money. He copied lectures and assignments from UC Berkeley one-to-one. I ended up learning more from UC Berkeley's CS188 videos on Youtube than from his own lectures. He also barely responds on Piazza.
terrible. after this course, I think anybody can be a professor.
let me tell you, this class was a complete joke. didn't learn anything

This was the first time he taught this course and you could kind of tell. Maybe he will be better in the future. My advice would be to rely less on the Berkeley materials. His credentials imply he has knowledge in this area and I'd love to learn it directly. Homework was easy and midterms were insane but generously graded. Nice guy just needs time.

He's great example of an instructor who doesn't care about the course. He copied lecture notes and assignments from an other university, he didn't even put a little effort to change and adapt the materials. He doesn't reply to any discussion posts or emails. The materials is useless and Bergner aced in making materials more boring by his teaching

Not good at what he does. A lot of students in our class knew more than him about the subject. 

Has communication problems as well. His English is not very good. 

Talks about topics irrelevant to the subject all the time. 

In general, got an impression he is not interested in teaching and comes across as lazy.

Dr. Bergner made me want to choose data science as a career path! He's a brilliant, funny, and nice person. The course material is really well designed, easy to follow, and the exercises are pretty intriguing. Would highly recommend!

Great intro to computational data science. Steven was very helpful during lab time, and a very genuine person. Gave thorough replies on coursys questions, and overall a solid prof to have for this course. Only knock is that sometimes he spends a little too long on the tiny details during lectures. Assignments and project was v interesting.
